result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew L. Drake was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 18 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew L. Drake

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 1:39 p.m. Defendant Matthew L. Drake in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. 1 day CFTS. Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 18 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Matthew L. Drake in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi is requesting another date for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Matthew L. Drake in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Case Called @ 2:05 PM: Defendant Matthew L. Drake in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing in its entirety. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.  Def BOT with probable cause finding as to Ct Nos 1 and 2.   ARGN to proceed today.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 02:40 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 11:25 AM: Defendant Matthew L. Drake in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Defendant Matthew L. Drake in custody.  Stephanie M. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  ADA argues as to $2000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  SPD joins in request for Signature Bond.   Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
